[ANS] **Interviewer:** "So, you just thrust something into the farmer's hand, huh? What was going on in that moment?"

**Character:** "Well, you see, it was this really important item. I had to make sure it got to the farmer right away. I just couldn't let anything happen to it. It was like, I had to be quick and decisive. I didn't want to waste a second."

**Interviewer:** "That must have been a tense moment. How did you feel?"

**Character:** "I was a bit nervous, you know? But also really relieved. It was like a weight had been lifted off my shoulders. I just wanted to make sure everything was okay."

**Interviewer:** "What was the item?"

**Character:** "It was a small, but very valuable piece of jewelry. It belonged to my grandmother. She had passed it down to me, and I had to make sure it got to the farmer safely. It was a big deal to me."

**Interviewer:** "That's quite the responsibility. How did you feel after you made sure it got to the farmer?"

**Character:** "I felt a sense of accomplishment. It was like I had done something important. I was glad I could help out in that way. It was a small act, but it meant a lot to me."
